facts.text: Inter Miami CF was officially approved as an MLS expansion team on January 29, 2018.
David Beckham is a co-owner of Inter Miami CF.
Lionel Messi signed with Inter Miami CF on a free transfer in 2023.
Inter Miami CF began playing in the MLS in the 2020 season.
Inter Miami CF won their first major trophy, the 2023 Leagues Cup.
The 2023 Leagues Cup win qualified Inter Miami CF for the 2024 CONCACAF Champions Cup for the first time.
Inter Miami CF secured their first Supporters' Shield in the 2024 season.
As of 2025, Forbes estimated Inter Miami CF's value at $1.2 billion, ranking second in the league behind Los Angeles FC.
The Miami Fusion, a previous MLS team based in Miami, folded following the 2001 season.
David Beckham was given the option to purchase an MLS expansion team at a price of $25 million when he joined the league in 2007.
Beckham ended his playing career in April 2013 and discussed plans to buy an MLS soccer team in Miami that same year.
In 2007, David Beckham's contract included a clause that allowed him to own an MLS franchise at the end of his playing career.
The Miami-Dade County commissioners voted unanimously on December 17, 2013, to negotiate a new stadium in downtown Miami for the Beckham-led group.
Beckham exercised his option to own an expansion franchise in Miami on February 5, 2014.
The initial working titles for the Miami MLS club were "Miami Vice" and "Miami Current."
David Beckham bought Simon Fuller out of their Miami MLS franchise ownership in May 2019.
The Miami Beckham United group was awarded the 25th MLS franchise on January 29, 2018, set to launch in the 2020 season.
Inter Miami CF was announced as the official name of the Miami MLS club on September 5, 2018.
Inter Miami and Nashville SC were added for the 2020 MLS season, prompting the 2019 MLS Expansion Draft on November 19, 2019.
Inter Miami won the coin toss for the Expansion Priority Draft on October 6, 2019, and chose to select first in the expansion draft.
Diego Alonso was announced as Inter Miami's inaugural head coach on December 30, 2019.
Rodolfo Pizarro scored the first goal in Inter Miami's history on March 7, 2020, in a game against D.C. United.
Inter Miami's first MLS game was on March 1, 2020, against Los Angeles FC.
Inter Miami recorded their first franchise victory on August 23, 2020, against Orlando City SC.
Diego Alonso left Inter Miami by mutual consent on January 7, 2021.
Phil Neville was appointed as the head coach of Inter Miami on January 18, 2021.
Kieran Gibbs joined Inter Miami in the summer of 2021 when his contract with West Brom expired.
Blaise Matuidi signed for Inter Miami on a free transfer on August 13, 2020.
Matuidi made his club debut for Inter Miami on September 6, 2020, in a match against Nashville SC.
Blaise Matuidi announced his retirement from professional soccer on December 23, 2022.
Romeo Beckham made his non-competitive senior debut for Inter Miami on January 26, 2022, in a pre-season win against Club Universitario de Deportes.
In 2021, Inter Miami CF was fined $2 million by MLS for violating roster rules during the 2020 season.
Jorge Mas, owner of Inter Miami CF, was fined $250,000 in 2021 for the club's violation of MLS roster rules.
Paul McDonough, former sporting director of Inter Miami CF, was suspended from league activities through the end of the 2022 season for violating MLS roster rules.
Inter Miami CF's allocation was reduced by $2.27 million for the 2022 and 2023 seasons due to roster rules violations.
Gonzalo Higuaín signed for Inter Miami on September 18, 2020.
Gonzalo Higuaín scored his first goal for Inter Miami on October 7, in a 2–1 win against the New York Red Bulls.
Leonardo Campana joined Inter Miami on a season-long loan from Wolverhampton Wanderers on January 20, 2022.
Leonardo Campana was named MLS Player of the Week for Week 6 of the 2022 season.
Leonardo Campana signed with Inter Miami on a permanent basis on January 20, 2023.
Josef Martínez was traded to Inter Miami from Atlanta United on January 18, 2023.
DeAndre Yedlin joined Inter Miami on a four-year contract with an additional one-year option on February 2, 2022.
Lionel Messi announced his intention to join Inter Miami as a free agent on June 5, 2023, after leaving Paris Saint-Germain.
Lionel Messi signed his Designated Player contract with Inter Miami on July 15, 2023.
Gerardo Martino was appointed as the head coach of Inter Miami on June 28, 2023.
Lionel Messi and Sergio Busquets were formally unveiled as Inter Miami players on July 16, 2023.
Jordi Alba signed for Inter Miami five days after Lionel Messi's unveiling ceremony, on July 21, 2023.
Following Lionel Messi's arrival, Inter Miami became the top-selling team across all sports on Fanatics.
The average price for tickets to Inter Miami matches on StubHub increased five-fold to $161 after Messi's arrival.
Forbes valued Inter Miami around $1 billion after Lionel Messi joined the team, marking a 72% increase from 2023.
Inter Miami was invited to participate in the Copa Libertadores following Lionel Messi's signing.
Lionel Messi and Sergio Busquets made their debuts for Inter Miami on July 21, 2023, in a 2–1 win over Cruz Azul in the 2023 Leagues Cup.
Lionel Messi scored the winning goal from a free-kick in stoppage time during his debut match for Inter Miami against Cruz Azul.
Inter Miami won its first-ever trophy by defeating Nashville SC 10–9 on penalties in the 2023 Leagues Cup final on August 19, 2023.
Following their 2023 Leagues Cup win, Inter Miami qualified for the CONCACAF Champions Cup for the first time.
Inter Miami won the 2023 U.S. Open Cup by beating FC Cincinnati on penalties 5–4 after a 3–3 draw in extra time.
Inter Miami lost to Houston Dynamo FC 2–1 in the final of the 2023 U.S. Open Cup.
Lionel Messi made his first appearance in the MLS on August 26, 2023, in a match against the New York Red Bulls, which ended in a 2–0 victory for Inter Miami.
Inter Miami's 12-match unbeaten run ended on September 16, 2023, with a 5–2 loss to Atlanta United FC.
Inter Miami was eliminated from making the MLS playoffs after a loss to FC Cincinnati on October 7, 2023.
Lionel Messi won his 8th Ballon d'Or on October 30, 2023, while playing for Inter Miami.
Inter Miami signed Uruguayan forward Luis Suárez on December 22, 2023.
Inter Miami secured their first Supporters' Shield on October 3, 2024, after a match against Columbus Crew.
Inter Miami finished the season with a league record 74 points.
FIFA announced on October 19, 2024, that Miami would host the 2025 FIFA Club World Cup.
Inter Miami was eliminated in the first round of the MLS playoffs by Atlanta United FC on November 10, 2024.
Javier Mascherano was hired as the new head coach of Inter Miami.
The team name "Club Internacional de Fútbol Miami" (Inter Miami CF) was unveiled on September 5, 2018.
The crest of Inter Miami features two great white herons with interlocking legs forming a letter M.
The Roman numerals MMXX in Inter Miami's crest represent the year 2020, the team's inaugural season of play.
Inter Miami's colors are pink, white, black, and a bit of blue.
The birds in the Inter Miami crest were confirmed to be white herons after some debate.
In February 2020, Inter Milan sued Inter Miami for trademark infringement over the use of the term "Inter".
In what year did Inter Milan file a claim with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office for the protected use of "Inter"?
When did MLS file an objection to Inter Milan's trademark claim on the name "Inter"?
April 2019
In what year did Inter Miami CF and Inter Milan sign a settlement regarding the trademark dispute over the name "Inter"?
Which company became the official timekeeper for Inter Miami CF in March 2024?
Tudor
What was the original name of Chase Stadium, the home of Inter Miami CF?
DRV PNK Stadium
How much did the renovation and creation of the soccer-specific stadium for Inter Miami CF cost?
$60 million
What total cost was reported for the whole renovation and creation of the soccer-specific stadium for Inter Miami CF, including additional facilities?
$140 million
In response to Lionel Messi's planned move to Inter Miami in June 2023, how many seats were planned to be added to the stadium?
3,000 to 3,200 seats
From where were the bleacher seats used in the expansion of the stadium for Inter Miami CF sourced?
Miami International Autodrome
On what date was the stadium naming rights partnership with JPMorgan Chase announced, rebranding Inter Miami CF's stadium as Chase Stadium?
February 20, 2024

In 2016, the Fort Lauderdale Strikers announced they were moving out of Lockhart Stadium, leading to the stadium's disrepair before Inter Miami announced intentions in January 2019 to use the site for their training ground and a new 21,550-seat stadium.
The Fort Lauderdale city council unanimously approved Inter Miami's bid for the Lockhart Stadium site in March 2019.
On July 9, 2019, the Fort Lauderdale City Commission unanimously approved a 50-year lease agreement for the Lockhart Stadium site with Inter Miami.
Inter Miami's stadium was branded as DRV PNK Stadium in April 2021 following a naming rights agreement with AutoNation.
A second expansion completed in January 2024 increased DRV PNK Stadium's capacity to 21,550 seats.
Inter Miami began playing in Fort Lauderdale in March 2020 and will continue to do so until the Miami Freedom Park stadium is completed.
The Miami Freedom Park project, including a 25,000-seat stadium, was approved by roughly 60% of voters in a public referendum held on November 6, 2018.
Miami-Dade Circuit Judge Mavel Ruiz preserved the results of the November referendum, allowing city administrators to negotiate a 99-year lease with Inter Miami's ownership for Miami Freedom Park.

The Miami Freedom Park development, associated with Inter Miami CF, is planned to include 1,000,000 square feet of office, retail, and commercial space, 750 hotel rooms, 23 acres of public soccer fields, and a 10.5-acre stadium.
The club owners of Inter Miami CF will make annual installments of $20 million for 30 years for improvements to public parks across the city as part of the Miami Freedom Park development.

Before settling on the Melreese site for Miami Freedom Park, locations considered included Dodge Island at PortMiami (2013), the Downtown Miami waterfront at Museum Park (2014), a site adjacent to MLB's Marlins Park (2015), and a privately owned site in Miami's Overtown (2015–16).
Beckham announced in June 2019 that Freedom Park was proposed to launch in 2022, but the stadium is now projected to open in the 2025 MLS season.
Construction of Miami Freedom Park began in August 2023, with the current projection of completion being 2026.
Inter Miami CF announced in January 2019 its intentions to use the Lockhart Stadium site in Fort Lauderdale as the club's training ground for its first team, youth academy, and future USL team.
The Florida Blue Training Center, Inter Miami CF's training facility, covers 30 acres and includes a park, youth soccer fields, a community center, and seven training fields.
The Florida Blue Training Center includes the 5,000-seat AutoNation Sports Field, which has been the home ground of Major League Rugby club Miami Sharks since their debut in 2024.

Inter Miami CF announced a partnership with Brightline in April 2022 to provide passenger trains from Miami and West Palm Beach to Fort Lauderdale station with a dedicated shuttle for fans, named the GOOOL Getter, for home matches.
The original ownership group of the franchise now known as Miami Freedom Park LLC was led by Marcelo Claure and formed in 2013.
Masayoshi Son and brothers Jorge and Jose Mas joined the Miami Freedom Park LLC ownership group in 2017.
David Beckham negotiated an option to own an MLS expansion team at a discounted franchise fee when he signed with LA Galaxy in 2007.
On September 17, 2021, Beckham and the Mas brothers bought out Marcelo Claure and Masayoshi Son's stakes in the ownership group.
Inter Miami CF has four official supporters groups: The Siege, Southern Legion, Vice City 1896, and Nación Rosa Y Negro.
Inter Miami CF's rivalry with Orlando City SC is known as the "Florida Derby."
Inter Miami CF has an intracity rivalry with USL Championship club Miami FC, known as the "Miami Clásico."
Inter Miami CF announced the formation of a reserve team to compete in USL League One on October 9, 2019.
Fort Lauderdale CF rebranded as Inter Miami CF II on February 24, 2022, ahead of their move to MLS Next Pro.
The Inter Miami CF Academy was established in 2019 and competes in the MLS Next soccer league starting from the inaugural 2022 season.
Ray Hudson served as the color commentator for Inter Miami's broadcasts in the 2020 season.

Inter Miami's regional English-language television deal announced on April 3, 2020, was with CBS Television Stations, airing matches on MyNetworkTV affiliate WBFS-TV and selected matches on CBS station WFOR-TV.
On April 30, 2020, Inter Miami announced a Spanish broadcasting rights deal with Univision, airing games on TV affiliate WAMI and radio affiliate WQBA.
Kieran Gibbs was named the media director for Inter Miami and its network on February 23, 2023.
Heineken became the official beer of Inter Miami through a partnership announced on August 6, 2019.
Inter Miami announced a multi-year partnership with Duracell as its official power partner on February 15, 2024.
Inter Miami renewed its partnership with the cryptofinance firm XBTO as the Official Cryptofinance Partner on March 12, 2024.
In May 2024, Inter Miami announced a premium multi-year international partnership with Visa Inc.
After the 2023 season, all Major League Soccer regional television contracts expired, with television coverage moving to MLS Season Pass on Apple TV.
Lionel Messi's Inter Miami unveiled their new home kit named 'Euforia' for the 2025 MLS season.
Inter Miami expanded DRV PNK Stadium ahead of the 2024 MLS season.
The Miami MLS expansion team began play in 2020.
MLS announced David Beckham's expansion team in Miami on January 29, 2018.
Inter Miami won the 2024 MLS Supporters' Shield.
David Beckham increased his ownership stake in Inter Miami on September 17, 2021.
David Beckham revealed the purchase of the MLS Miami franchise on February 5, 2014.
Inter Miami CF was founded in 2018 and is based in Miami, Florida.
David Beckham is one of the owners of Inter Miami CF.
Gerardo Martino is the head coach of Inter Miami CF.
Inter Miami CF's future stadium is named Miami Freedom Park.
Inter Miami CF reached the 2023 Leagues Cup final.
Inter Miami CF reached the 2023 U.S. Open Cup final.
Inter Miami CF's kit manufacturer in 2020 was Adidas.
XBTO was the shirt sponsor for Inter Miami CF in 2021.
Xmanna was the shirt sponsor for Inter Miami CF in 2022.
Lionel Messi transferred to his current club from Paris Saint-Germain in 2023.
Sergio Busquets joined his current club from Barcelona in 2023.
Jordi Alba's tenure with his current club is set to begin in 2025.
The team won the Supporters' Shield and the Eastern Conference (Regular Season) in 2024.
The team won the Leagues Cup in 2023.
Gerardo Martino had a win percentage of 52.24% during his tenure from July 10, 2023, to November 22, 2024.
Javier Mascherano became the head coach on November 26, 2024.
Luis Suarez was the top goalscorer in the 2024 season with 25 goals.
The team's average attendance in 2024 was 21,245.
The team finished 1st in the MLS regular season and Eastern Conference in 2024.
The team's highest win percentage under a coach was 52.24% under Gerardo Martino.
In what year did Lionel Messi score 15 goals for an MLS team?
How many goals did Lionel Messi score in total for an MLS team as of the last recorded statistics?
49 goals
What was the highest stage Lionel Messi's MLS team reached in the CONCACAF Champions Cup as of the last recorded statistics?
Semifinals (SF)
What was the average attendance at Lionel Messi's MLS team's matches in 2025?
